alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Knott; Magoffin; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 11:09PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Perry, northwestern Knott, central Floyd, eastern Breathitt and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 1145 PM EST... At 1109 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Tiptop to near Lunah to Hardshell to near Lamont. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Daisydell, Duco, Carver Station, Tiptop and Lambric around 1115 PM EST. Gapville, Fredville, Decoy and Buck around 1120 PM EST. Evanston around 1125 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Dotson, Vail, Orchard, Gunlock, Waldo, Ordway, Blue River, Pyramid, Elmrock, Dock, Vest, Prestonsburg, Lancer, Mid, Hippo, Yellow Mountain, Dwale, Soft Shell, Martin, Allen, Bolyn, Corn Fork Hollow, Eastern, Hueysville, Bosco, Alphoretta, Handshoe and Langley. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 14. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 11 and 20. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 9 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
